name: Aberration
description: A beholder hovers in a cluttered laboratory. The Aberration card embodies things contrary to nature.

person.upright: Someone with a distorted view of reality, perhaps a cultist or a warlock of the Great Old One; perhaps simply an eccentric person with a nonconformist style.
person.reverse: A person (perhaps a druid) dedicated to preserving nature against corrupting influences.

creatureTrap.upright: A creature corrupted by the influence of the Far Realm, or an Aberration.
creatureTrap.reverse: A creature that has resisted the corruption of its nature, or a trap that deals psychic damage.

place.upright: A place where the laws of physics or magic are suspended or distorted.
place.reverse: A place where nature has overgrown the remnants of a corrupting influence.

treasure.upright: An art object that reflects a warped view of reality, or a magic item made by Aberrations.
treasure.reverse: An art object depicting the triumph of nature over corruption, or a magic item useful against Aberrations (such as a Ring of Mind Shielding).

situation.upright: An incursion of energy or creatures from the Far Realm or the deep Underdark.
situation.reverse: People or creatures fighting against the influence of Aberrations.
